title: Fetch error: OpenSSL
body:
Either the OpenSSL URL schema has changed, or a micro-revision bump caused the existing URL to become invalid.

### Spack version

```console
$ spack --version
0.14.1-449-a4b3edd68
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install openssl
==> 16620: Installing openssl
==> Fetching http://www.openssl.org/source/openssl-1.1.1e.tar.gz
################################################################################################################################ 100.0% -=O=-          #       #       #         #
curl: (22) The requested URL returned error: 404 Not Found
==> Failed to fetch file from URL: http://www.openssl.org/source/openssl-1.1.1e.tar.gz
    URL http://www.openssl.org/source/openssl-1.1.1e.tar.gz was not found!
```

### Additional information

The `url` property on the package definition is *only* valid for the latest version of each series:
```python
    url = "http://www.openssl.org/source/openssl-1.1.1d.tar.gz"
    list_url = "http://www.openssl.org/source/old/"
```
older version URLs look like `http://www.openssl.org/source/old/1.1.1/openssl-1.1.1d.tar.gz`.

### General information

- [x] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
